wikipedia_page.main:
Andrew Hunter (August 1864 in Joppa, Ayrshire, Scotland – 19 June 1888 in Australia) was a Scottish former footballer known for scoring Aston Villa's first goal in the FA Cup.
He also played for Ayr Thistle, Third Lanark and Vale of Leven, before coming to England. Like his more famous brother, Archie, he died young from a heart attack.
